author: Liam Prenderville
title: Mark Noble confirms Dimitri Payet was removed from West Ham Whatsapp group - but only after Marseille move
text:
Noble speaks to Payet during training (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Mark Noble has confirmed Dimitri Payet was removed from West Ham's WhatsApp group once his move to Marseille was confirmed. 
Reports suggested the Hammers players had turned their back on Payet after he went on strike at the London Stadium and stopped speaking to him via the messaging service. 
The Frenchman told boss Slaven Bilic he didn't want to play for the club and eventually forced through a move back to Marseille. 
Noble has dismissed those suggestions but has confirmed Payet left the group, once his exit has been confirmed. 
"No, that is rubbish it's totally rubbish," he said. Payet celebrates scoring with Noble (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) The pair in happier times last season (Photo: Jason Mitchell/IPS/REX) 
"I think he was only removed when he had actually signed for Marseille. 
"That was once it was done and his medical was done because obviously you don't want hundreds of messages going to him when we are here." 
West Ham have responded to Payet's transfer request by winning three of their last four matches in the Premier League. 
And skipper Noble insists the Hammers ship is much more settled one, following the France international's exit. West Ham's players celebrate at Southampton (Photo: PA) Payet celebrates his first goal for Marseille (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
"Obviously we were gutted. The manager, as you saw from his press conference, was obviously gutted as well," he told Sky Sports News HQ. 
"He didn't want to get rid of Dimi, but he wanted to get rid of the situation. Obviously we had to deal with all of that and the best way to do that was by winning games, that's what we've done. 
"It was a tough time for all of us. But it has become a happy place again." poll loading Who will have the last laugh? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
